item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, February 13, 2025 at 6:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Resigning as Asahi Linux project lead (622 points | 409 comments)
2. White Hat Hackers Expose Iridium Satellite Security Flaws (60 points | 10 comments)
3. Do you need permission from the government to do independent research? (34 points | 9 comments)
4. I built a failed startups goods website and named it VcSubsidized.com (34 points | 10 comments)
5. TSMC Faces Tough Choices Amid Rumors for Intel Foundry Collaboration (68 points | 44 comments)
6. LibreOffice still kicking at 40, now with browser tricks and real-time collab (79 points | 17 comments)
7. Magnetic field sorting of superconducting graphite particles with Tc>400K (36 points | 13 comments)
8. U.K. demand for a back door to Apple data threatens Americans, lawmakers say (200 points | 125 comments)
9. Basis of the Kalman Filter [pdf] (43 points | 4 comments)
10. SQL pipe syntax available in public preview in BigQuery (122 points | 54 comments)
11. Better text rendering in Chromium-based browsers on Windows (84 points | 68 comments)
12. Self hosted FLOSS fitness/workout tracker (135 points | 80 comments)
13. An Infinitely Large Napkin [pdf] (2019) (133 points | 23 comments)
14. WASM-Native Orchestration (33 points | 6 comments)
15. Why Does Integer Addition Approximate Float Multiplication? (127 points | 35 comments)
16. Cheap blood test detects pancreatic cancer before it spreads (192 points | 112 comments)
17. Residential Networking over Telephone (65 points | 17 comments)
18. Tiny JITs for a Faster FFI (287 points | 118 comments)
19. Why young parents should focus on building trust with their kids (436 points | 314 comments)
20. The World Without a Mask (1934) (8 points | 2 comments)
21. Large magma bodies found beneath dormant volcanoes, surprising scientists (77 points | 21 comments)
22. Smuggling arbitrary data through an emoji (620 points | 177 comments)
23. Thinkserver: My web-based coding environment (190 points | 53 comments)
24. The average CPU performance of PCs and notebooks fell for the first time (275 points | 207 comments)
25. NESFab – A new programming language for creating NES games (173 points | 11 comments)
26. Evolution of Whois Protocol to RDAP (2019) (11 points | 6 comments)
27. The Prophet of Parking: A eulogy for the great Donald Shoup (296 points | 282 comments)
28. Leaking the email of any YouTube user for $10k (1541 points | 433 comments)
29. Larry Ellison wants to put all America's data in AI, including DNA (94 points | 121 comments)
30. Usaid funding freeze disrupts global tuberculosis control efforts (47 points | 24 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, February 13, 2025 at 6:20 PM UTC
